intents.description: ask about the Vault before starting the test

values.text: I didn't understand. You can try rephrasing.
Can you reword your statement? I'm not understanding.
I didn't get your meaning.

Question 6:
Old Mr. Abernathy has locked himself in his quarters again, and you've been ordered to get him out. How do you proceed?

Question 5:
Your grandmother invites you to tea, but you're surprised when she gives you a pistol and orders you to kill another Vault resident. What do you do?

Question 4:
Congratulations! You made one of the Vault 101 baseball teams! Which position do you prefer?

Question 3:
You discover a young boy lost in the lower levels of the Vault. He's hungry and frightened, but also appears to be in possession of stolen property. What do you do?

Question 2
While working as an intern in the Clinic, a patient with a strange infection on his foot stumbles through the door. The infection is spreading at an alarming rate, but the doctor has stepped out for a while. What do you do?
Good work! You have finished the test. Let me process your results...

Question 10:
Alert! Super-mutants are attacking with all their big guns. Casually you happen to be in the Vault's weapon arsenal. What do you do?

Question 9:
You decide it would be fun to play a prank on your father. You enter his private restroom when no one is looking, and....

The GOAT Test will judge you on the skills you use. If you choose to react to a situation in a particular way that means you feel comfortable with your used abilities, and therefore are likely to respond the same way in similar situations. This will allow us to assign you the best possible role in the Vault for you.
Please note that we are testing your skills, not your morals. To understand your skills it is necessary that you explain not only your intentions but how would you carry them out.
Example: "I attack the enemy" doesn't show any skill, but "I punch the enemy in the face" would show that you are good with unarmed combat.

Question 8:
A fellow Vault 101 resident is in possession of a Grognak the Barbarian comic book, issue number 1. You want it. What's the best way to obtain it?

Question 1:
You are approached by a frenzied Vault scientist, who yells, "I'm going to put my quantum harmonizer in your photonic resonation chamber!" What do you do?

The Vault™ series of survival shelters is a type of hardened subterranean installation designed by Vault-Tec Corporation on contract with the U.S. government to protect a selected fragment of the United States population from nuclear holocaust so that America could be repopulated.

On October 23, 2077, the world was devoured in flames as a result of The Great War, a global thermonuclear war caused by the Sino-American War. It resulted in the destruction of all participating nations and abroad, global disruption of the climate and billions of casualties as a result of nuclear blasts, exposure to radiation and the subsequent collapse of social and government structures, all within the span of just two hours. 
Only those who sheltered in underground Vaults managed to survived to this day.

Question 7:
Oh, no! You've been exposed to radiation, and a mutated hand has grown out of your stomach! What's the best course of treatment?

Welcome to the Vault!
The Generalized Occupational Aptitude Test (G.O.A.T.) is a Vault-Tec occupational assessment test that every resident of a vault is required to take at the age of 16
Are you ready to start? You won't be allowed to ask questions once the test has started
